poem:
"An Intrigue of Coin"

In the theatre of gold and gavel,
A circus act of power unravels. 
Cheap boasts, echoed tomes,
Hidden paths where truth roams.
His fortress of coin, a beacon, yet a shroud,
Knowingly or not, he avows out loud.
Thus, the dance of hush-money's strain, 
Word-twisting attempts, all in vain.  
Can one but ignore his own fiscal refrain?
